full_text: Welcome to the validation demonstration. Remember that the goal of the claim is to wreck the ability to pay maturity level. The claim must be at this maturity level before any of the exposures can be paid. Eileen Lang wants to see the maturity level of this latest claim. The validation level for this claim is new loss completion. Recall that the validation levels in the base configuration are load and save. New loss completion. Valid for ISO. Send to external system. And, ability to pay. To see what keeps the claim from reaching ability to pay. Eileen attempts to validate the claim. At the ability to pay level. The validation results pane displays three errors, all of them on the contacts page. Eileen wants to fix the problem so that the claim will be at ability to pay, so she clicks one of them to navigate to that page. Then she clicks clear to dismiss the validation results pane. Since the problem is lack of a primary address for Ms. Mackenzie, Eileen clicks her name on the contacts list. And, under the basics tab, clicks edit. She scrolls down to the primary address section. Eileen enters Ms. Mackenzie's street address. Films. Films. Films.   Films. Films. Films. Films. Films. Films.   Films. Films.                  Films.  Films. Films. Films. Films. She clicks Update to save the address. To verify her work. She goes through the same basic steps as before. Choosing this time to validate the claim and its exposures to ability to pay. This time, no errors are found and the claim and exposures are validated to ability to pay. Eileen closes the Validation Results pane. Since her work is now done. Eileen logs out of Claim Center. This concludes the demonstration of Claim and Exposure Validation.

segments.text: Welcome to the validation demonstration. Remember that the goal of the claim is to wreck the ability to pay maturity level. The claim must be at this maturity level before any of the exposures can be paid.
Eileen Lang wants to see the maturity level of this latest claim.

The validation level for this claim is new loss completion. Recall that the validation levels in the base configuration are load and save. New loss completion. Valid for ISO. Send to external system. And, ability to pay.
To see what keeps the claim from reaching ability to pay.
Eileen attempts to validate the claim.
At the ability to pay level.
The validation results pane displays three errors, all of them on the contacts page.
Eileen wants to fix the problem so that the claim will be at ability to pay, so she clicks one of them to navigate to that page.
Then she clicks clear to dismiss the validation results pane.
Since the problem is lack of a primary address for Ms. Mackenzie, Eileen clicks her name on the contacts list.
And, under the basics tab, clicks edit.
She scrolls down to the primary address section.
Eileen enters Ms. Mackenzie's street address.
Films.
Films.

Films.
Films.
Films.
Films.
Films.
Films.
She clicks Update to save the address.
To verify her work.
She goes through the same basic steps as before.
Choosing this time to validate the claim and its exposures to ability to pay.
This time, no errors are found and the claim and exposures are validated to ability to pay.
Eileen closes the Validation Results pane.
Since her work is now done.
Eileen logs out of Claim Center.
This concludes the demonstration of Claim and Exposure Validation.
